alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington and east central Hancock Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Deblois, or 12 miles northwest of Cherryfield, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cherryfield, Steuben, Columbia Falls, Columbia, Deblois, Franklin, Eastbrook, Waltham and Beddington. This includes US Highway 1 near Cherryfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock
